title: PvP.Net is constantly disconnecting everythime I log into League of Legends.
body:
I am having trouble with my PvP.Net connecting. Every single time I log into League of Legends, my PvP goes red. Whenever I'm in a queue, and I lock in, it says "Attempting to reconnect". Eventually, it obviously doesn't work. I try to "manually" reconnect to League of Legends but it doesn't work. I have tried disabling the IP Helper and it only tales the red signal away. 

I have found a solution, however it opposes unreliable. I have to disable my Firewall EVERYTIME I would like to play on League, I desperately need help, Riot. 

If anyone else has the same problem as I do, please comment. I know I'm not the only onnnnnnne.

replies.body: What ISP are you with? What OS are you on?
What do you mean by ISP and OS?

First, I want to check to make sure you are still getting this exact problem.

OS means Operating System. This is the first bit of software you install on your computer to run other programs with, examples being Windows 7, iOS (Mac) and Linux Mint. ISP means Internet Service Provider, and is the company who provides you with an internet connection. Usually also a telecommunications companies, some examples are Telecom, Optus and Vodafone.

Yeah, I get it. I just never fully understood what those terms meant. My computer is an HP and it currently has Windows 8.1 installed on it. My internet provider is Vodafone. 

I really do appreciate your attempts to provide a solution to my horrible situation. 

If there is anything information your require, don't hesitate to enquire.

It's just a bit odd that you didn't reply for two months, is all.

Anyway, I presume you've done the basic stuff like making sure all the cables are properly connected, resetting your modem/computer and turning off your firewall.

Try completely uninstalling your firewall and anti-virus (if applicable) and running League. Be sure to reinstall them later.

Double-check that you've tried everything on [this page](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664), mainly, using an alternative DNS.

Your ISP, Vodafone, has pretty good records in my books. Windows 8, however, not so. I suggest you upgrade to Windows 10 if feasible, or even better, downgrade to Windows 7.

I have done all the 'basic' things to attempt to fix the issue and it has not worked. What do you mean by "try everything on this page"? You've only provided that basics and yes I have gone to the connection and PvP Riot issues page, not of it works.

I'll try and upgrade to windows 10
